results.title: Nostromo. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Alastair Reid, Fernando Ghia, BBC, Pixit, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Television Espanola and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Joseph Conrad, set in South America in the late 1880’s. An Englishman, Charles Gould, and his wife Emilia return to his childhood home to reopen his silver mine. Determined to make the mine succeed, he becomes involved in corruption, conspiracy and revolution. Gould becomes obsessed with saving the silver mine but there is only one man he can trust - Nostromo. Starring Colin Firth, Claudio Amendola, Lothaire Bluteau, Albert Finney, Claudia Cardinale and Brian Dennehy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alastair Reid, Fernando Ghia, BBC, Pixit, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Television Espanola and WGBH (Boston)

results.title: Nosferatu. Vampyr
results.brief_description: Dreyer’s ‘Vampyr’ (dir. Carl Theodor Dreyer, prods. Carl Theodor Dreyer, Nicolas de Gunsburg) redefined the Vampire by casting an eerie woman as the vampire and shooting the entire film with black gauge on the lens to create a haunting, misty mis-en-scene that lingers with each viewing. Cast includes Julian West, Maurice Schutz and Sybille Schmitz. ‘Nosferatu’ (dir. F. W. Murnau, prods. Albin Grau, Enrico Dieckmann) is the original Dracula movie, complete with misty woods, wolves, phantom ships, mutes, coaches and grotesque figures, tropes that are considered standard today in the genre. Cast includes Max Schreck, Alexander Granach and Gustav von Wangenheim. Also included on the tape a rehearsals from varying productions of Dracula.

results.title: Nosferatu (Dracula). - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Paul Killiam, Saul J. Turell and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
A horror tale about a vampire who stalks his victims in the deepening shadows of the night. An edited version of the 1922 German silent motion picture, Nosferatu (Dracula), directed by F. W. Murnau, with commentary. Cast features Max Schreck as Dracula.

results.title: Norwegian children: farming on a fiord
results.brief_description: A farm family on a fiord in Western Norway. Shows activities of children and mother tending livestock on the mountains during summer; dairying activities such as milking, cheese making and transporting milk to the dairy in the valley. Concludes with a neighbourhood festival to celebrate the homecoming of the women and the children.

results.title: Norwegian architecture and applied arts
results.creator_credit: Informasjonsfilm and Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs
results.brief_description: Examines the origins of modern Norwegian architecture in the home crafts of rural Norway. Scenes depict craftsmen at work wood carving, glass blowing, pottery making, weaving and making jewellery and enamel ware.

results.title: Northwest passage
results.creator_credit: Bernard Gosselin, Francois Seguillon and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: It took a supertanker like the U.S.S. Manhattan, assisted by a nimble icebreaker, the Canadian John A. Macdonald, to realize the dream of centuries: the navigation of a commercial sea lane through the Arctic channels. This is a record of that historic expedition, filmed in colour from both ships and from a reconnaissance helicopter. Commentary by ships’ navigators and observers, and shipside sounds of formidable sea ice groaning, straining and cracking make this an adventure rarely seen on film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bernard Gosselin, Francois Seguillon and ONF | NFB

results.title: Northern wildlife
results.creator_credit: John Jacob, Brad Smart and Newswatch
results.brief_description: The past 200 years has been a period of great upheaval and trauma for the native creatures of Australia. Introduced animals have learnt to adapt to the alien environment at the expense of the native inhabitants, many of which have become tragically extinct. The issues surrounding wildlife management are wrought with varying opinions and passionate sentiment. Narrated by Alan Dale, this video investigates the work being done to preserve endangered native species and to control introduced species in the Top End.

results.title: Northern trails. Pts 1 and 2
results.brief_description: Silent film with English sub-text. Travelogue of Norway including footage of Stavanger, winding mountains and valleys and the amazing roads which travel through them; cattle farming in remote mountainous areas; Alesund - famous for its fishing and surrounded by many beautiful lakes and snow-capped mountains; glaciers; fjords; passenger steamers travelling from village to village and local peasants in traditional costume at work and at play.

results.title: Northern Territory/Indonesia
results.brief_description: Presented by Paul Murphy, this is an excerpt from SBS Television’s “Dateline” program. It presents an examination of the multidimensional nature of the relations between the Northern Territory and Indonesia.
